channel.title: Setup your workstation :: book.rymcg.tech
channel.description: You should dedicate the use a physical or virtual Linux machine to be used as your workstation. A single workstation can manage several remote Docker contexts. Follow the Linux Workstation book for details on basic workstation setup. All the commands in this chapter assume you are using the standard Bash shell. Index Install Docker client tools Install d.rymcg.tech tools Create SSH config and Docker Context Install Docker on your remote host Main config for d.

item.title: Install Docker client tools
item.description: You need to install Docker Engine (not Docker Desktop!) on your workstation. You will completely disable the Docker daemon on your workstation, youâ€™re only installing Docker Engine for its client tools (eg. the docker command). Various ways to install Docker Engine Try your system package manager Some Linux distributions have decent packages for up-to-date Docker versions. Some other distributions lag behind by several versions, or may even introduce non-standard changes of their own.

item.title: Install d.rymcg.tech tools
item.description: Install d.rymcg.tech and its dependencies on your workstation. Install dependent packages If you run Fedora workstations, run this as root dnf install bash gettext openssl git xdg-utils jq sshfs curl \ inotify-tools httpd-tools make wireguard-tools If you run Debian/Ubuntu workstations, run this as root apt-get install bash build-essential gettext git openssl \ apache2-utils xdg-utils jq sshfs wireguard curl \ inotify-tools If you run Arch Linux workstations, run this as root pacman -S bash base-devel gettext git openssl apache xdg-utils \ jq sshfs wireguard-tools curl inotify-tools Clone d.

item.title: Create SSH config and Docker Context
item.description: To remotely control your Docker host from your workstation, you need two additional configs: SSH Host config in ~/.ssh/config. Docker Context config via docker context create .... Both of these can be created automatically by running: [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d context new This will prompt you if you really want to proceed: (stdout) ? This command can help create a new SSH config and Docker context. Proceed? (Y/n) y You can choose to create a new SSH config, or use an existing one:

item.title: Install Docker on your remote host
item.description: The base Debian image only has a few basic commands preinstalled. You must now install the Docker packages and enable the service: Choose the active Docker context d context [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d install-docker Tip d install-docker will install Docker on the remote VPS, according to your active docker context. Test that the context works from your workstation [bash]: Run this on your workstation: docker run hello-world [bash]: Run this on your workstation: docker ps

item.title: Main config for d.rymcg.tech
item.description: Select your active Docker context [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d context Each Docker context has a separate config file (.env_{CONTEXT}), stored in the root d.rymcg.tech directory (~/git/vendor/enigmacurry/d.rymcg.tech), so you must actively select your current context before you can configure it. Configure d.rymcg.tech for the current Docker context [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d make - config This will create a config file for your current Docker context, and name it .
